documents.document: @mancunianmedic @drohanlon @DeirdrelangLang @drlfarrell I can’t see your tweet as apparently it might be offensive!

@drdsharp07 @CSPD_HSE @ProjectECHO The design guide looked at local examples of great practice that are already up and running, presented a rationale and guidance for whoever wherever you are in the system for each of the components. Full implementation would require new approaches yes.

Patient flow is a complex thing. Focusing only on the acute element (or annual leave) will not address the issue. A whole system approach 2 urgent & emergency care (most of which needs 2 happen outside of hospital) will. A blueprint & design guide was developed & agreed @CSPD_HSE https://t.co/9M7cxQJ06e
@shiel_olivia Thank you Olivia. Im a bit exercised but I’m trying to be objective and evidence based😡

Another little #ethicalleadership thought for the day. It would appear that certain mechanisms of #moraldisengagement are being used at the moment-specifically displacement of responsibility. https://t.co/ZMvTRaU0PA

I’m going to retweet myself for the first time but I’m trying to make a point here. As I research #leadership there are times when things have to be called as they are. #disruptiveleadership https://t.co/IQwu65pF03
@fionak132 @DeirdrelangLang @doccallanan @IEHospitalGroup @MullingarFIT @GEMSStLukes @WexFit @LaraBourton Great!
@Antcon7062 He also dislikes sarcopaenia and generally thinks we are over medicalising ageing #mybestcritic

@Antcon7062 I think it conjures a particular negative image? I think the term is more for our benefit as HCPs than the people we serve. I was chatting with my dad last night before #irishmed and he thinks it’s the former
@doccallanan Would be great to see some of the great @IEHospitalGroup work at the conference? https://t.co/Vu78P4MtQH
@ucdmedsoc Nice thread. Tnx @betterbeaumont https://t.co/qXzlpuXcS0
@Antcon7062 My parents really object to it!
I love this thread @Trisha_the_doc https://t.co/hIVzAn8YmM
@annsinead Very true 👍
Thanks for a great chat @drlfarrell @DeirdrelangLang Think this is a topic we’ll need to return to. A Good night to all and to all a good night! #irishmed
CT: Words matter they can heal or they can hurt. We need to agree together what are the right words and I don’t think we’ve got there yet. #IrishMed
@neiljohare Clinical redesign of how work is done
@BarbyIngle I think if you get people to think how they would feel it would help. Scenarios a bit like Kiefer Sutherland’s character in flat liners - bet that would work (but extreme maybe) #irishmed
@BrianwDolan Im all for respectful challenge 👍
@22Q11_Ireland @drlfarrell That’s a good tip! #irishmed
@DeirdrelangLang #greatminds 😂😂 #irishmed
T5: education education education #IrishMed
@DeirdrelangLang What did you do?
@BrianwDolan Couldn’t agree more 👍
@gmcrotty Aarrrgggghhh yes! Hate it!! #irishmed
T4: I take the advice of Ed Schein and hopefully do it nicely with good questions #IrishMed
@BrianwDolan 😢
@wareFLO Great quote! #irishmed

T3: I challenge myself and others to think about how we would feel to hear such words used about us. That said some words can be used to create a compelling case for change Does that justify such language or is that moral disengagement #pseudomoraljustification #irishmed
https://t.co/QTLBMQn6dc
@gmcrotty Grand thanks and your good self?
@DeirdrelangLang Both probably but words do matter
T2: because that’s what we were taught and what we observed during training ‘We are what we see’ #irishmed
@irishgerontsoc Funnily enough my parents quite like that one #irishmed
@DeirdrelangLang Aaarrrg yes- I hate bed-blocker #irishmed
